fields.description:
h3. Summary
Username with uppercase letter unable to create Service Desk

h3. Steps to reproduce
- Create admin user with uppercase letters in username (ex. "TestUser")
- Login in as TestUser
- Create Service Desk

h3. Expected Results
- Service Desk created, screen is redirected to the newly created Service Desk.  The default configurations for queues, SLA, metrics are there.

h3. Actual Results
- Unable to get past first dialog page
- If you check your projects, the new project was created, but there are no configurations added (queues,SLAs,metrics,etc).

h3. Workaround
- Rename the user to have all lowercase letters. (from example: "TestUser" to "testuser")
fields.summary: Username with uppercase letter unable to create Service Desk

After JRA-1330 ( field level security permission) was closed with "Won't fix", we all had high hopes because JRA-27613 was the long missing answer to achieve the same goals without having JRA-1330.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-194].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

Currently after the SLA configuration is set, it starts counting according to what was configured but there is no way to reset the SLA.

h3. Expected behaviour

We want the ability to reset the SLA as sometimes there can be exceptions to the configurations that were set or something was misconfigured.

h3. User case

# John is an Administrator who have set the conditions for his service desk SLA. 
# There were a couple of exceptions to the SLA rules in two tickets and the SLA started to count before it should.
# John wants the ability to reset the SLA manually so he can fix the problem for these two tickets and future similar cases that can occur.
fields.summary: Ability to reset the SLA

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 29th November 2018}
Hi All,

You can now import SLA’s from your existing projects to new ones! This has been available since Jira Service Desk 3.8.x. 
To find out more check out the release notes: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-8-x-release-notes-936509559.html]
 
On behalf of the JSD team I want to thank all of you for your patience.

— JIRA Service Desk Team
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-191].
{panel}
In our setup, we have a servicedesk project per customer. Most of the SVD setup (like workflow, calendars & standard offered SLA metrics) are the same for all projects, while other aspects (users/project roles/...) are specific for each SVD project.

having tens of SVD projects, means each time the same SLAsetup needs to be configured manually:
 * SLA metrics
 * Calendars
 * ...

.. while other specifically generated setup is not wanted:
 * workflow
 * screens
 * issuetypes
 * ...

Being able to control which defaults are used during 'create project' wizard, would be really helpful. 
 Alternatively, a clone/copy-from-existing SVD project would work as workaround -> if this were possible, we could use a template project to copy from.
fields.summary: Service Desk templates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-179].
  {panel}

A customer requested to have Pareto charts being provided as part of JIRA Service Desk. Here is what she said: 

"To manage solving the problem long term, we want to prioritize the items we go after:  biggest bang for the buck.   We use Pareto charts to see where the most issues occur, so that if we solve that problem (software change, training, redundancy, etc.), then we get the biggest return on future call prevention.

As we discussed at the conference, it would be great to have JIRA Service Desk support Pareto charts.  
If a gadget were a Pareto chart, I would think that it would follow current gadget setup including:  Pick the filter you want to use and pick the field to use across the bottom of the chart (example:  System, location, root cause… etc.)

The black line is just the cumulative percent up to 100%, where Pareto 80-20 rule: which items together solve 80% of the problems.  Chart is sorted left to right by number\% of tickets. "

Check the attachment for a visual representation

Check the following links for more details:
http://wiki.servicenow.com/index.php?title=Pareto_Charts
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pareto_chart
http://asq.org/learn-about-quality/cause-analysis-tools/overview/pareto.html
fields.summary: Pareto chart

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-178].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer facing Service Desks often need to cater to a variety of problems that are similar in nature. Many Service Desk type solutions offer the ability for forms to be dynamic, so that the options chosen in one form, display different options in subsequent fields. 

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA Service Desk should provide some form of functionality to create 'advanced' forms that can be customised to allow dynamic functionality. 

h3. Workaround 
Add-On vendors provide this behaviour, for example: [Extension (aka Service Pack for JSD)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.intenso.jira.plugins.jsd-extender]
fields.summary: Use of dynamic fields on forms

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-177].
  {panel}

As a service desk user, I need to be able to create multiple JIRA issues from a single service desk request. 

For example, I'd like to create a portal for managers to request equipment for a newly hired employee. I need to automatically create tasks for multiple departments (HR, Facilities, Desktop Support, Server support, Telecomm Support, etc.)

In this example, I'd need the following issues created and assigned to the various departments/queues/components:
- Initial issue created by manager: New Employee John Doe
- HR Approval for new employee John Doe (HR)
- Assign office space to new employee John Doe (Facilities)
- Setup email account for John Doe (Server support)
- Setup Windows account for John Doe (Server support)
- Setup UNIX account for John Doe (Server support)
- Setup and Install desktop or laptop for John Doe (Desktop support)
- Setup and install phone/phone number/voicemail for John Doe (Telecomm support)
fields.summary: Create multiple related or sub-tasks from one request.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-160].
  {panel}

Ability to link user to a company/customer to enable following features and store contact information. 

* User can view My Issues and My Company Issues.
* User can automatically linked to company by email domain.
* Company contact information can be viewed within issue.
* SLA's can be linked to company.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-157].
  {panel}

* Did a clean install of JSD 1.1.1 on a JIRA with prepopulated projects and issues.
* Created a SD for an existing project
** When I try to delete one of the request types I get 404 (Request URL from chrome: http://192.168.0.4:8080/1/delete?projectKey=undefined&issueTypeId=undefined)
** When I try to add a new metric, Metric name field cannot be filled. It is readonly
fields.summary: JSD 1.1.1 problems

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-156].
  {panel}

The new feature with [JSD-41] is great, however when you have a group with starting with "<Department Name Starting with the letter "B">" and a group named "General", and most of your request types are in the "General" category, the  "<Department Name Starting with the letter "B">" by default is selected when you view the customer portal. 

There is no way to move "General" to the top and/or have it selected by default.

Thanks,
Shane

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-152].
{panel}
There are many situations where you want to use JIRA Service Desk on the go.
 There are different scenarios from the customer and support site so you will need both a mobile optimised service desk and a native mobile app.

The existing JIRA mobile interface doesn't capture all the needs. It's also a different user experience if you compare it with service desk.

As a customer i want:
 * Track the progress of my issues
 * Create new requests
 * Comment on my issues
 * Upload a photo of a defect
 * Search the knowledge base

As a support agent i want:
 * Don't print the issue to have all details of the issue with me
 * Change the status of the issue on the go (workflow)
 * Create new requests or sub tasks
 * Upload a photo of a defect
 * Search the knowledge base

That are only a few of my thoughts.

The JIRA mobile interface is actually really basic for service desk users.
 I know there are many JIRA apps on the App Store but an official app from Atlassian for JIRA Service Desk Customers would be good deal.

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 02 Feb 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

This is Charlie from the Jira Service Management team. I'm pleased to let you know that we have released support for Jira Service Management (JSM) in our Jira Server mobile apps ([Android|https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.atlassian.jira.server] & [iOS|https://apps.apple.com/us/app/id1405353949]) as part of the [Jira Service Management 4.15 release|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-15-x-release-notes-1043891577.html?permissionViolation=true#JiraServiceManagement4.15.xreleasenotes-mobile].

You’ll need to install the latest version of the [Mobile Plugin for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220151/mobile-plugin-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] from Atlassian Marketplace, or upgrade to Jira Service Management 4.15 or later, which includes the plugin out of the box.

We will continue to add further JSM functionality to the apps over the coming months. 

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of September 30, 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

I’m pleased to let you know that we’ve officially started the Beta program for Jira Service Desk support in the Jira Server app ([iOS|https://apps.apple.com/au/app/jira-server/id1405353949] & [Android|https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.atlassian.jira.server])

Agents can now transition requests through their workflows, view Jira Service Desk projects and issues, comment internally and externally, and more. We will continue to add further Jira Service Desk functionality over the coming months.

Please refer to our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/jira-server-mobile-app-1026523326.html] for more details on how to enable and access Jira Service Desk on your mobile device.

You don’t have to sign up for our Beta program—it’s available for everyone and we would love for you to share your feedback by shaking the app, or joining the discussion on our [community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-articles/Jira-Service-Desk-Server-and-Data-Center-support-on-mobile-Beta/ba-p/1494364#M363]. So, go ahead and try it out!

Charlie, JSD Server Team
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of June 11, 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

I'm pleased to update this ticket to 'In Progress'. The Jira Service Desk team is actively working on supporting JSD issues and projects within the Jira Server apps on Android and iOS.

Charlie, JSD Server Team
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of March 13, 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Thank you all for your comments and suggestions on the ticket.

Though there has been delay on this, we want to let you know that making JSD mobile available is of high priority to us and +on our short-term roadmap+. Please watch this space for more details.

Mandeep, JSD Server Team
{panel}

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-151].
  {panel}

Morning [~bbaker], [~shamid@atlassian.com], [~miruflin], hope you had a top weekend. 

Raising the following on behalf of a colleague here at Twitter, not breaking into individual stories as I figured you may suggest workarounds for part/all (I'm new to all this fancy Service Desk SLA goodness!).

Cheers, have a top week,
Nick

*Question*
Has our ability to meet SLA improved this quarter? How much have we improved?
Chart a time series of "percentage of success over the past X days" to track the change in our SLA success over time.

*Scenario*
Localization provides translations for new and updated strings in the product. They have established service-level agreements regarding the window of time that can be allotted to translation. 

JIRA Service Desk provides improved functionality around SLAs. Issues have SLA information attached, queues of at-risk and breached issues are on hand, and reporting gives real time insight into the status of tasks at hand. 

Localization provides its stakeholders a report that shows the average time to resolution for the month/quarter. Localization can also point to the SLA (named “Time to Resolution”) to see its percentage of success in the current week. Still, stakeholders ask for SLA success over time. 

*Opportunity*
* New JQL function: SLA
** Example: SLA = “Time to Resolution” and CreatedDate = startofmonth() and “Time to Resolution” != breached()
* Modified Gadget
** Using the SLA function several charts (Created vs Resolved, Pie Chart, Cumulative flow) could be modified to display breached and unbreached issues in a way that supports the report described above.
* New Service Desk Report Series
** Success Rate
** Example: Time to Resolution - Success Rate
** This series would allow for a report to show the success percentage over time in the same way that average time to resolution is shown.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-150].
  {panel}

Dears,
I am contacting you because we have a Jira installation in our company, working with VertygoSLA and we are facing a problem with the ordering of the SLA's.
One of our customers reported this to us, we did perform a re-indexing which did not solve the problem and we have opened a ticket to Valiantsys (VSLA-1148 on their Jira) but their approach is that you have acquired their plugin and will embed it to Service Desk module.
Can you please tell me which is the best way to get support on our problem as we really need to provide a solution to our customer?
Kind regards,
Alexander Baltazzis

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-149].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of Bug

Some issue records, especially with high SLA values show incorrectly when exported to Microsoft Excel.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Service Desk issue, and leave it for a few days (works best this way)
# In the Issue Navigator, add the 'Time to resolution' and 'Time waiting for support' fields. Search for the Service Desk issue, and take note of the values of those fields
# Export the search results into Excel (tested with 'Current Fields'), and check the value for those fields. 

The original value is supposed to be :
!SLA 3.png|thumbnail!

But in Excel it is shown as :
!SLA 2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SLA values are incorrect when exported into Excel

The same phenomenon can occur even IE · Chrome.

The results are the same whether you clear the cache.

I was not able to find the right answer in the Answers.

I do not know at all whether there is a cause other settings, or whether not good.

Because it can not be made to function the service desk in the state now, I'm having problems so.

Because I am not good at speaking English, I'm sorry If I had a bad speech.

I hope that I get an answer that can be resolved to someone! !

Thanks in advance.

h3. Summary of Bug

When accessing a knowledge base suggestion from JIRA Service Desk, the Code Macro is not rendered in the popup

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Connect your JIRA Service Desk to a space in Confluence (as the Knowledge Base)
# When raising a Service Desk request, try to click on the knowledge base suggestion on the right side of the screen
# The knowledge base page will popup like this :
!SDS KB.png|thumbnail!
But there should be a code macro in that page, like this :
!Conf KB.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-131].
  {panel}

(This is a cross-post from https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/229837/service-desk-email-format-links-on-issues-created-from-email-vs-customer-portal as I was advised to report this as a bug here based on the response by Brad Baker at Atlassian.)

In trying to create a consistent customer experience for our end-users who we're now supporting with Service Desk, I've noticed that emails sent by JIRA for issues created by the Email Handler use a different format than emails sent by JIRA for issues created via the Service Desk Customer Portal.

Example #1: Email format for issue created by Email Handler:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16273/Screenshots/email%20from%20issue%20creation%20via%20email.jpg

Example #2: Email format for issue created by the Service Desk Customer Portal:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16273/Screenshots/email%20from%20issue%20creation%20via%20customer%20portal.jpg

I'm looking for how we can setup the email handler in Example #1 to match the email format (including links to the Service Desk Customer Portal) in Example #2. Right now, the customer experience is like we're using two separate systems for this. Links in Example #1 go to the default JIRA UI instead of going to the Service Desk UI for customers.

It's like we need the ability to create an email handler for a Service Desk -- but I see no way to do this in OnDemand. Is this working as designed or is there a bug with the code that Brad says "tries to suppress the fact that the reporter gets both a SD email and a JIRA email?"

As an additional note, issues created in JIRA via email handlers do NOT show up under the "My Requests" view from the customer portal in Service Desk. It's like our email handler is ignoring the fact that we have Service Desk enabled. I wanted to mention that here in case the two issues are related, however I can submit a separate bug report for this particular problem if need be. FWIW, we were a Service Desk Beta user in case that has any implications on our configuration.

Our SEN # is: SEN-2196722

Thanks,

-Eric

  {panel}

The Connected Vehicle Services subsidinary of Agero is the only group using JIRA.  This part of Agero had been acquired by SiriusXM recently.  As the result, the email addresses were all converted to SiriusXM domain. 

We need to update all the user accounts with Atlassian with new email addresses to continue recieve support.  

Please help with the following:
1. Provide a list of Arlassian accounts with email domain 
2. I will review the list to deterine which users need to be remomved, and which one needs to be updated with new SiriusXM addresses

Thanks.  

-Daphne

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-118].
  {panel}

h3. Problem description

After starting a free trial of JIRA Service Desk through the "Manage Add-ons" page of an OnDemand instance, half of the add-on's modules get disabled, no "Service Desk" drop-down button appears at the top navigation bar and the "Get Started" button redirects to a 404 page - https://domain-name.atlassian.net/servicedesk/agent/all (due to the modules being disabled):

!jira_service_desk.png!

h3. Workaround

Manually enable all modules of the add-on.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-117].
  {panel}

A JQL query on issue currently support querying by elapsed or remaining time but only in absolute values like...
"Time to response" < remaining(2h)

That function should also support querying by percent of SLA target. Something like...

"Time to response" > elapsed( 60% )

... which lists issues that has elapsed SLA time of more than 60% of total SLA target on "Time to response".

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-113].
  {panel}

Hi,

We offer multiple contract/ support levels to our customers, and we have hundreds of customers for each level.  Each contract level has a specific set of SLAs attached to it.

Based on this feedback:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/SLAs?focusedCommentId=420973375#comment-420973375

...it looks like you can't do that w/ the current SLA tool, without having to do  a huge JQL query for each priority level and contract type combination, for instance "priority = Blocker and reporter in (company1, company2, company3, company4, company5, etc.)" where the list of companies is, as I mentioned, hundreds of companies long.

For us that's a non-starter, so we really need that added.
fields.summary: SLA enhancement: multiple SLA types/ contract groups

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-112].
  {panel}

After creating or clicking into a service desk form, there does not seem to be any options to click or go back into jira dashboard (home page once you log in).

The only options I seem to have are:
1) click on the 'back' button on browser several times to get there 
or 
2) type in companyname.jira.com to get there

Please provide a way to go back to the main screen from where the original user came from
fields.summary: There does not seem to be an option to go back to JIRA dashboard (home page)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-108].
  {panel}

Lately when I try to edit the series in my reports, I get one of two behaviours.

Either:
1.  The edit screen takes around 10 seconds to load and the JQL filter section looks scrunched (see screenshot attached - clicking 'basic' then 'advanced' again resolves the issue).
2.  The edit screen does not load at all.  I tested multiple reports, I can't see a pattern (i.e. the edit screen does not load at all for one of my 'created vs resolved' but does load slowly for another 'created vs resolved' with more restrictive JQL).
fields.summary: Series in Reports - Slow to load, or unable to edit at all (in some cases)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-107].
  {panel}

(i) _*Update 13 Jan 2016: JIRA Service Desk now has a public REST API. See [comment below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-107?focusedCommentId=853509&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-853509].*_

As outlined in this answer question https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/225223/does-jira-service-desk-have-a-public-rest-api# JIRA Servicve Desk does not currently have a public REST API.

We do have internal REST resources that we use in the agent view and we plan to expand that into the "customer portal view" soon but these do not have the strong API guarantee against change. They are there to support the "dynamic browser front end".

Service Desk is of course built on top of the JIRA platform so issue creation / retrieval REST APIs are available via standard JIRA facilities.

https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/

As the JIRA Service Desk architect I am intrigued to learn more about about what type of REST APIs people would like and what use cases you are trying to satisfy and how they are more specific to JIRA Service Desk than the current JIRA public REST api.

Please use this improvement request on JAC (https://jira.atlassian.com/) or send me a direct email on brad.baker@atlassian.com to further discuss what you are after.
fields.summary: Create a public REST API for JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-105].
  {panel}

*Acceptance Criteria*
* Service Desk owner can add 'temporary' or 'visual' fields that do not create new fields in JIRA
* The values of those fields condense into one JIRA field (ie, Description)

This saves us from creating hundreds of custom fields for text entry.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk admin I would like to create multiple fields on the customer portal and have them condense into one *real* field in JIRA

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-104].
  {panel}

The *Create Issue* button in JIRA doesn't obey to the Look and Feel color scheme defined when the *JIRA Service Desk* plugin is enabled. 

*+Steps to Reproduce:+*
# Modify the *Button Background Color* color in the Look and Feel.
# Install and Enable the *JIRA Service Desk*.
# Navigate to the Dashboard.

*+Expected Behavior:+*
JIRA would display the *Create Issue* button in the color defined in the Look and Feel.

*+Actual Behavior:+*
This is displayed in the default blue.
fields.summary: Create Issue button in JIRA doesn't follow Look and Feel when Service Desk is enabled
